page.title: 08Home Life in Eaton Bray
page.content: Most people shop in the nearby towns as the local shops are expensive and do not offer the same choice of goods. The vast majority travel by car, but for those relying on public transport, there is an hourly service to Dunstable (4 miles) and a two-hourly service to Aylesbury (11 miles). To Leighton Buzzard (3.5 miles), the bus runs only twice a week, on market days. A doctor's surgery and dispensary has recently opened in Edlesborough, and prescriptions can be collected from Eaton Bray Post Office. Well babies and toddlers can be seen at the mobile clinic which visit the villages each month. Mobile libraries visit EB fortnightly and Edles. every 3 weeks. A neighbourhood watch scheme is in operation because of concern at the growing number of house burgularies.
